data.text: @MyYard27 Thank you 🙏 I really appreciate it

@AmeliaFitzrovia I looked it up and they still have it! Not only that but the history is really cool. Apparently the collection once belonged to an actual spy who was from Alabama. When he died, his collection was given to the museum. I haven't been since I was a teenager. https://t.co/Mjodkf6QZA
@BTBouttanowhere Good to know that he is recovering. My prayers and best wishes 🙏🙏🙏

@MyYard27 He's a lot better. He's in rehab now and it's going slowly because he broke his ankle when he fell (when he had the stroke, he fell at a weird angle and hit his ankle got twisted.) He's not able to walk yet, but he's been able to stand on his own a few times.

@AmeliaFitzrovia Two of them! That's kinda the museum's point of pride. They are cool. The rest of it is mostly animals. The Berman Museum is next door and they have lots of civil war and WWII stuff. I don't know if they still have it, but they used to pride themselves on having Hitler's tea set.

@MyYard27 It's a bad virus because of what happens after you're over it. I have no energy at all. I've barely been able to get out of bed some days. And covid is also why dad had his stroke. 
I appreciate it 🙏 I'll be ok, don't worry. I've improved a lot. I'm getting there.
